title: Old Bay Corn Muffins Recipe
full_text:
Old Bay Corn Muffins Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Cook
15 mins
Active
10 mins
Cooling Time
5 mins
Total
25 mins
Makes
12 muffins
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1 1/2
cups
medium grind
cornmeal
1/2
cup
(about
2 1/2
ounces
)
all purpose flour
1 1/2
teaspoons
baking powder
1 1/2
teaspoons
low sodium
Old Bay seasoning
(see note)
1/2
teaspoon
chile powder
1
teaspoon
salt
1 1/4
cups
buttermilk
1
egg
2
tablespoons
butter
, melted, plus more for greasing tin
1
cup
grated
sharp cheddar cheese
Directions
Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 375°F. Grease muffin tin with butter.
In a medium bowl, stir together cornmeal, flour, baking powder, Old Bay, chile powder, and salt. In a small bowl, whisk together buttermilk and egg. Add buttermilk mixture to dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Stir in butter, followed by cheese.
Pour batter 3/4 way into prepared tin. Bake until a cake tester inserted into the middle of a muffin comes out clean, about 15 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes then transfer to a wire rack. Serve warm.
Special equipment
12 cup muffin tin
Muffins
Savory
Cornmeal
